intro: Secamone filiformis, commonly known as the slender secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
